ygData.subject: Re: Exploits
ygData.msgSnippet: Two things. First, you will never have a project of this magnitude without having some bugs making it to release undiscovered.  Software is inherently buggy,
ygData.messageBody:
Two things.
First, you will never have a project of this magnitude without having some bugs
making it to release undiscovered. Software is inherently buggy, its a fact of
life, get used to it, you will see it happen more and more.
Second, they have stated that people found exploiting a bug will be warned. If they
continue to exploit the bug, then they will be punished. Its painfully obvious why
they don't list bugs. They don't want to be forced into policing them 24/7. If you
stumble onto something that is a blatent bug, report it so that it gets fixed, and
move on. If you find something that could go either way, enjoy it until a GM/Guide
tells you to stop.

>
>
> Well, tough! They (Verant) made the game, and now they are trying to punish US
> for playing it the way it is! They designed it and they have the bugs in. So let
> them fix the bugs and not tell us "no you can't do this". That's stupid. They
> created the game and I'm playing it the way it is.
>
> furthermore, nowhere on their site do they have a list of exploits that should be
> avoided. They do not give us a list when we log in to the game. Yet, we're
> supposed to just know them? How stupid is that?
>
> THEY made the design error / bug, and now they expect us not to "exploit" it
> without even letting us know what's an exploit and what's not! They are punishing
> us for their laziness / un attentiveness!
>
> --
> Sergey
> --
> KPS PUNK (Paramilitary Undercover Nuclear Kamikaze)
>
